title: Scaffolding Strategy-Based Curriculum for Enhancing Mathematical Problem-Solving Skills in Adult Learners

context.prior_knowledge: Basic arithmetic operations and experience applying simple mathematics in daily life
context.additional_context: Combines online learning platforms with offline workshops using digital devices (tablets/laptops), emphasizing collaborative problem-solving among learners.

learning_goals: Learners apply a sequencing strategy to decompose and solve complex mathematical problems step-by-step.
Learners enhance their ability to solve mathematical problems independently as pedagogical scaffolding gradually decreases.

Learners can express three real-life problems (e.g., budget management, space utilization) as mathematical models (equations, graphs, etc.) once a week during a 6-month course, receive scaffolding support (step-by-step hints, case analysis), and propose solutions with 80% or higher accuracy.
Learners achieve over 80% accuracy in summative assessments by applying step-by-step problem-solving and scaffolding reduction strategies.

resources: Digital Learning Platform for Math Problem Solving (LMS-Integrated)
Customizable Feedback Template for Scaffolding Reduction

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
